intro: Sloanea pilosa, commonly known as the hairy sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its hairy, dark green leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in spikes. Sloanea pilosa is often found in shaded understory environments, and it has a woody stem that can reach several meters in height. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native ecosystems.
